title: Mahindra XUV700 diesel sales increase 25 percent in FY2025
description: The Mahindra XUV700 SUV crossed the 2,50,000 sales mark in January 2025 – within 3.5 years since its launch. Interestingly, diesel has been the preferred fuel choice among the buyers of this Mahindra SUV despite stricter emission norms and the government’s 10-year rule for diesel vehicles in the Delhi-NCR. So far in FY2025, 75 percent of the XUV700s sold had a diesel engine, with petrol accounting for the rest.  In first 10 months of FY2025, 59,073 units of diesel XUV700s were sold For the petrol versions, the tally stands at 19,690 units in the same period In fact, the last 50,000 units of the XUV700 were sold in the six months between August 2024 and January 2025. After the SUV’s August 2021 debut, it had taken a year to reach the 50,000 units mark due to limited production capacity. Currently, almost all XUV 700 variants command a one-month waiting period. Mahindra XUV700 April 2024 - January 2025 sales XUV700 fuel-wise sales: April 2024 - January  The sales of XUV700’s diesel variants have increased by over 25 percent year on year to 59,073 units between April and January, the first 10 months of FY2025. In the same period, the sale of petrol versions rose by 3.4 percent to 19,690 units.  Mahindra XUV700 seats and engine options Mahindra sells the XUV700 in 5- and 7-seat configurations, with several powertrain options. There are 46 variants in total: 22 petrol and 24 diesel. The 2-litre turbocharged petrol engine produces 200hp and a meaty 380Nm of torque. Further, the 2.2-litre diesel engine is available in two different states of tune: 155hp, 360Nm and 185hp, 420Nm. Transmission options, drive types   The engine is paired with a 6-speed manual or a 6-speed automatic gearbox. The base-spec MX trim is only available with a 6-speed manual, but for all other variants, buyers can choose between either of the two. Mahindra also offers the option of all-wheel drive for the AX7 and AX7L trims. Price, rivals The XUV700 diesel has a wide price range, starting from Rs 14.59 lakh for the base MX manual variant (5-seater) to Rs 25.74 lakh for the AX7 L AWD automatic (7-seater). Considering this, the XUV700 rivals both 5- and 7-seat SUVs, such as the Tata Harrier, Tata Safari, MG Hector Plus and Hyundai Alcazar. html:
The XUV700’s 2.2-litre diesel engine generates up to 185hp and 420Nm; prices start at Rs 14.59 lakh.

The Mahindra XUV700 SUV crossed the 2,50,000 sales mark in January 2025 – within 3.5 years since its launch. Interestingly, diesel has been the preferred fuel choice among the buyers of this Mahindra SUV despite stricter emission norms and the government’s 10-year rule for diesel vehicles in the Delhi-NCR. So far in FY2025, 75 percent of the XUV700s sold had a diesel engine, with petrol accounting for the rest. 

  1. In first 10 months of FY2025, 59,073 units of diesel XUV700s were sold
  2. For the petrol versions, the tally stands at 19,690 units in the same period

In fact, the last 50,000 units of the XUV700 were sold in the six months between August 2024 and January 2025. After the SUV’s August 2021 debut, it had taken a year to reach the 50,000 units mark due to limited production capacity. Currently, almost all XUV 700 variants command a one-month waiting period.

The sales of XUV700’s diesel variants have increased by over 25 percent year on year to 59,073 units between April and January, the first 10 months of FY2025. In the same period, the sale of petrol versions rose by 3.4 percent to 19,690 units. 

Mahindra XUV700 seats and engine options

Mahindra sells the XUV700 in 5- and 7-seat configurations, with several powertrain options. There are 46 variants in total: 22 petrol and 24 diesel. The 2-litre turbocharged petrol engine produces 200hp and a meaty 380Nm of torque. Further, the 2.2-litre diesel engine is available in two different states of tune: 155hp, 360Nm and 185hp, 420Nm.

Transmission options, drive types  

The engine is paired with a 6-speed manual or a 6-speed automatic gearbox. The base-spec MX trim is only available with a 6-speed manual, but for all other variants, buyers can choose between either of the two. Mahindra also offers the option of all-wheel drive for the AX7 and AX7L trims.

Price, rivals

The XUV700 diesel has a wide price range, starting from Rs 14.59 lakh for the base MX manual variant (5-seater) to Rs 25.74 lakh for the AX7 L AWD automatic (7-seater). Considering this, the XUV700 rivals both 5- and 7-seat SUVs, such as the Tata Harrier, Tata Safari, MG Hector Plus and Hyundai Alcazar.

All prices ex-showroom, India
